thread.title: Pamella Roland show glitzy beading at NYFW | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Pamella Roland show glitzy beading at NYFW | Daily Mail Online

author: Carly Stern For Dailymail.Com
title: Pamella Roland show glitzy beading at NYFW | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Pamella Roland was the belle of the ball that is New York Fashion Week on Friday, showing a Fall 2017 collection that was elegant, sophisticated, and totally glitzy. Styled for the show by Erin Walsh, the collection pays homage to artist Mark Rothko and his use of texture and glittered in shades of tobacco, amethyst, garnet, moss, onyx, and aubergine. 'Pamela's signature evening silhouettes with feather accents are shown alongside classically sharp and tailored separates, telling a color story that transitions from warm subtle hues into richer, deeper shades [and] looking as though it's been hand-painted,' the shows program explains. Ta da! Pamella Roland presented her Fall 2017 collection at New York Fashion Week on Friday Gotta sparkle: The stunning collection was packed with glitzy, beaded gowns Super style: A few of the elegant pieces had long, billowing capes Much of the beading was in deep, dramatic hues and accented with lush fabrics A program for the show explained that Pamella was inspired by artist Mark Rothko RELATED ARTICLES
